TypeSignature.Value: public struct SqlDateTime : IComparable, System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

.class public sequential ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit SqlDateTime extends System.ValueType implements class System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, class System.IComparable, class System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Docs.summary: Represents the date and time data ranging in value from January 1, 1753 to December 31, 9999 to an accuracy of 3.33 milliseconds to be stored in or retrieved from a database. The SqlDateTime structure has a different underlying data structure from its corresponding .NET Framework type, <xref:System.DateTime>, which can represent any time between 12:00:00 AM 1/1/0001 and 11:59:59 PM 12/31/9999, to the accuracy of 100 nanoseconds. SqlDateTime actually stores the relative difference to 00:00:00 AM 1/1/1900. Therefore, a conversion from "00:00:00 AM 1/1/1900" to an integer will return 0.
